description:
Authentic Vietnamese breakfast in the 'Loin, close by the Hilton Union Square. 

Open when a lot of places nearby were closed, the big colour photos of pho in the window caught my eye. The presence of some regional dishes (particularly banh mi bo kho) drew me in. 

There were local tech heads nitpicking about the type of milk in their Vietnamese coffee, a man and his very young niece/granddaughter who were sharing the beef balls from a bathtub size bowl of pho, and a girl who wanted nothing to do with meat - "vegetables only" she requested. An entertaining crowd. 

My banh mi bo kho was delicious: big fatty chunks of fall-apart beef in a thick broth with onions and chunks of stewed carrot. There was a suspension of fresh cut herbs and other vegetables in the stew to make the mix pop. The meat was long stewed, but the finishing touches were fresh. The banh mi was too soft to my preference: it had none of the crack that you get in Vietnam with a good baguette. 

Coffee was oh so dark and rich. The condensed milk was a treat at the last sip. 

Definitely worth a revisit. Group suitable.
author: Richard L.

description:
When I arrived in San Francisco in 2012, I was crashing at my friend's place a block from here at the time, and sometime in that first week I stumbled across this unassuming place. It was so good that I kept coming back for more at least once a week, even after I've moved out to the outer sunset.

Everything is delicious on the menu, especially the stuff that are pictured. My favorites are the iced coffee, beef stew, dry pho (#26), and the rice dishes #63 and #64 are my go to favorites when I don't feel like eating noodles.

You can never go wrong with Pho Tan Hoa, and the owners are so nice!
author: Po B.

description:
I love this place for a quick breakfast/early lunch. It's no frills, cash only, but their southern style pho is consistently good. It's authentic, and not out to people please--it's hearty, basic good pho. 

The people here work hard and serve quickly. I've never had a bad experience here, so five stars on food, service, and price.
author: Kimberly R.

description:
$12 for a small bowl of bun bo hue full of meats and hot soup. It's a bit pricey for the quality, service, and ambiance, but what do you expect when it's located in the Tenderloin. The only plus side is that they don't skimp on the protein. This is the only place that gives you more meats than noodles!

You'll get the service you'd expect in a place like this, so be sure to 

As a heads up, it's cash only with an ATM inside.
author: Patty B.

description:
Pride Weekend 2018, packed by lunch. Southern style Pho, darker broth, no fresh noodle, sliced rare steak, and is OK if you have a hangover.

Rice dishes, Beef Stew are a few OK dishes. The rest is  foods, CASH ONLY, but service was quick and efficient by the elderly man/owner. He took your order, speak broken English, somewhat rude tone of voice, but all guests listen! 

If you don't mind seeing the homeless shooting up and drug addicts in this area, come for a quick fix. Closet walks from Union Square, just 4 blocks of walking. Unfortunately, it's a big problem in this rich city of San Francisco. It breaks your heart to see how divided here. 

If you have young children, or single woman, just be vigilant.
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
No brainer!!!! Food is awesome, big portions great price. Remember cash only and the staff is so nice. 
The street it's on is super dirty, homeless laying there and pissing on the wall and doing/dealing drugs but don't let that stop you lol. Food is worth it, the restaurant is authentic Vietnamese large tables sit anywhere type of style. It's not a dinner date place.. more of a great lunch spot or take away.
author: Kate D.

description:
Near Glide you will find Pho Tan Hoa.

Hopped in here recently to grab my usual combo pho. Prices at first glance looked a little bit higher than what I expected given the neighborhood and just other restaurants I've visited in the area. 

The pho was pretty good but not enough for me to warrant a return visit. 
The service was friendly and the hot piping soup came out quickly like many of the popular Pho places in the City .

The world needs a SF Bay Area Pho Rankings...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings.

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places. 
Rod's Pho Rankings for SF Bay Area:
1 Ly's Vietnamese Cuisine
2 Turtle Tower
3 Rang Dong Restaurant
4 Golden Star Vietnamese Restaurant
5 Pho Huynh Hiep 2 - Kevin's Noodle House
6 R&D Café
7 Mai's Kitchen
8 Noodles Pho Me
9 Chopsticks Pho & Grill
10 Rice and Spoon Vietnamese Cuisine
11 Pho Tan Hoa
12 Pho VN Vietnamese Restaruant
13 Pho 2000
14 Pho Vi Hoa
15 Bistro Viet House
16 Pho Ty II
17 Pho Pasteur
18 Kim Huong
19 Pho 99
author: Rod M.

description:
A crisp day calls for pho! It's my unofficial rule and Pho Tan Hao hit the spot!

Veering closely into hangry, we ordered their rare beef pho and pork & shrimp spring rolls. Spring rolls we're everything I wanted and came with a large bowl of peanut sauce. 

As for the beef pho... For $9.99, it's a buck or two more than their neighbors, but they give you almost a half pound of beef. It was insane how much meat was provided! I had beef for literally every spoonful until I finished. Even then I had to start skipping the noodles just to finish the meat!

I was very impressed! 

*Cash only
author: Mandi W.

description: Pho was good with a lot of meat, but the overall service was quite hostile. I came in with my friend on Sunday at around 3:20 and we knew they closed at 4, so we wanted to order and eat as quickly as possible. When we went in, before I could even get a word in, the owner said "what do you want hurry up we close at 4 order now if you want something". Service isn't something I expect when I go eat at Asian restaurants, but for some reason this really ruined the experience for me. I probably wouldn't come back.
author: Helen z.

description:
Decent Pho place, you can get a huge bowl of pho for about $11 and it taste pretty good as well. The flavor is a little bit lighter than I like, and it could use a richer taste, but I'm not too picky given I'm in SF.

I ordered the Pho Dac Biet which is the medium sized bowl and it came with a good variety of meats. Generally I just get the beef with meatballs but decided to try a variety this time.

They also have the pickled onions here which is nice!
author: Tyler T.

description:
FYI: A Large is HUGE, it XL size, and a medium here is a Large.

I was in the area running a lunch errand and was craving some soup and noodles, it just so happened that Pho Tan Hoa was within walking distance. The area is not the best, but the noodle soup was good.

I got #8 which is the combo beef pho (without beef balls) and it was good. The broth has a nice deep beef flavor and not not overly oily like some places. There was A LOT of meat in the bowl, I had to separate the thinly sliced beef stack and I usually can finish a bowl of noodles with ease, but after all that meat even I was FULL. The inside and the old man taking order is standard Asian restaurant feel. There is little chit chat and most do not linger to long. 

They only things were that the hoisin sauce was a thicker than I am usually use to, the amount of bean sprout was below the about to places in Oakland, and they serve a lemon instead of a lime. Those are not deal breakers, but does affect my bowl of pho. 

If this place was closer to work, I would like to come back and try other things.
author: Mei L.

description: When you walk in to Pho Tan the boss immediately greets you with a smile and knows what you are hungry for before you even really know. #18 beef soup is our favorite. Quality food with great price! They open at 8am which is helpful in the weekend or during the week. We e been coming here for years and it's a staple to the neighborhood.
author: Amy K.

description:
Solid pho spot. Very tasty broth, decent portions and price. Fast service and nice workers too. What more could you ask for? Traditional SF asian style interior and typical tenderloin exterior. 

Don't forget to get viet iced coffee with your meal, its brewed fresh at your table and remember to slip it slow, it's potent!
author: Yosof R.

description:
You walk in hoping it would feel cool but instead it's a breath of warm air and a whole bunch of fans circulating in the corners of the room because they have no AC or too cheap to turn it on?? I came here with my mom and friend on a Wednesday afternoon craving for some pho. Wow -prices are high! Should be expected since we are in SF but $10-13 for a bowl of noodles is wayyyy over for me. My mom and friend ordered Pho Combination and I had the Pork Vermicelli with egg rolls. Of course the Pho bowls came out first and my mom finished eating hers by the time my dish arrived.

 

Vermicelli bowl: The first bite was the pork - SALTY, just salty. The egg roll tasted dry and old. The sliced cucumbers were cooked?? - I can tell by color and textured that it was slightly boiled (a NO- GO for me). The vermicelli noodles were mediocre and probably the only item that worked in this bowl. Underneath the noodles was the lettuce bed. The sauce on the side looks like it was mixed in with an egg roll dipping sauce. This overall bowl is not worth it to me at ALL. It looks delicious in pictures but the quality does not live up to their price. I usually pay between $8-9 for a Vermicelli bowl with the same toppings that taste FRESHHH.

 

Will not be returning!
author: Luc L.

description:
EVENT: It's one of those lazy Saturdays... I'm just chilling at home... doing nothing cause it's been a hard week of work... work.. workk... I wake up at 1pm... yups.. I'm tell y'all .... I'm hella lazy this week! Your girl have #hardtimes

SERVICE: This is one of the BEST! Let me repeat... seriously BEST, BEST-EST service I have EVER had! It just feels like home... y'all know? Your boy yells, "WHAT YOU WANT?" "OKAY" - If you miss your parents yelling at you... this is the place to go! #missinghome

FOOD:
(1) Raw Beef Salad - TONS of onions, carrots, little bits of crunchy peanuts (wish there was more), and some greens with RAW beef - squeeze a lemon and drench/dip the beef in a homemade sweet-sour fish sauce - best thing ever! **MUST GET ALERT!**
(2) Beef Pho - delish broth, love the thin sliced beef.
(3) Bun Bo Hue - tons of pork, tons of meat - mix the noodles and soup together cause the spicy sauce is on the bottom. I would like it a little more spicy-er... but no worries - there's a jar of chill oil on the side on the table

**MUST GET ALERT** - RAW BEEF SALAD - if y'all like it RAW!

**OVERALL: best service ever & rare beef salad! I'll be BACK! 5 stars!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
Best Vietnamese raw beef carpaccio I've had. Love the pho as well. The man who works is there, presumably the owner(?), is friendly and gives quick service.

I'm a fan!!
author: Teri Y.

description:
This pho place is only an 8 minute walk from Union Square! It's right at the edge of the Tenderloin so some people might not be comfortable with that walk, as you might pass by the shelter on Ellis street. Just keep to yourself and you will be fine!

The place is pretty big and has a bathroom. The server/owner was very friendly and LOUD lol. Our group of 6 was seated and served at a decent place. One thing that stood out to me was how much food was in the bowl. I got a small and it was like... a large? Even my bigger guy friends said their small was a lot of food. I got a lot of noodles but A LOT of meat. Like layers and layers of rare steak. That was great but I do wish the pho broth was stronger and darker. That might just be my preference though. If you want pho and are hungry, this place will be just right.

They also have a variety of drinks and the coconut water was super good! It comes with the body of the coconut and was very sweet (perfect for my sweet tooth). I believe they charge 50 cents per cup of water but you can get refills. Last but not least, it's CASH ONLY! So be prepared.
author: Crystal N.

description: Cash only! Broth is amazing prices run around $9-$12. Food is all good had a medium which was large.
author: Anamarie H.

description:
I'm a big fan of the pho here! I started coming here because it's pretty close to my apartment, but it's one of the better pho places I've tried across the city. Ordering a "small" bowl gives you a lot of meat (I usually get the #14 which has well-done brisket and rare beef), and the broth is tasty and filling. 

Service is also very fast. Sometimes you'll order and the food will be there before you have time to take off your jacket.

The location isn't the greatest, but since this is a daytime spot it's not a problem. Also be aware that it's cash only, but there's an ATM inside ($2.99 charge).
author: Joe B.

description: It was less than 5 minutes walking distance from our hotel.  We were in a time crunch so we decided to try this place.  I had the BBH and few others had their pho.  Being that we're all Asian and everybody finished their bowls, I'd say it was a win.  BBH was decent but not my best.  I'd go back if we were in town again though!
author: J T.

description:
Not much to report except:
- good pho
- but closes at 4pm?
- cash only
- small is a pretty good size for an average human
- they give a lot of meat! I didn't even finish
- broth is one of the better ones I've tried
author: Sally L.

description:
Great little pho place near Union Square.

We were nearby at the Alise hotel for a show at the Regency Ballroom. We love pho for breakfast after big nights and Pho Tan Hoa did not disappoint. My partner had eaten here over 20 years ago, and she said it was just as good as ever.

Don't let the exterior or the condition of the street fool you, walk inside and it's a beautiful restaurant. The food is really great and the service was perfect.

The prices were fair, even low considering we were in a touristy area of San Francisco.
author: Paul C.

description:
Great service, fast service, fun staff, good tendon, good broth, big fish in a fish tank who doesn't want to be bothered in the corner.

Noodles were exceptional, usually dont get noodles
author: Troy R.

description: While on a business trip to San Francisco, I was staying in the Union Square area was looking for a good bowl of noodles.  During my yelp search, I found that Pho Tan Hoa was right around the corner from the hotel I was staying at.  Note that this place closes early at 4pm. Luckily, I I was able to arrive just around 3:30pm for a quick bowl. Overall, the pho had good flavor and cut of meat were quite tender. The noodles were standard and service was quick and to the point. I also ordered a Vietnamese coffee was which strong and had the perfect amount of condensed milk. Overall, if you are looking for a quick bowl of pho and are in the San Fran Union Square area, don't overlook Pho Tan Hoa!
author: Albert H.

description:
Always come here for lunch when in SF. Have liked everything, which is more than I can say for the Slanted Door. They do close early and only cash. The portions are large and everything tastes fresh. They are efficient and friendly. Today I had #46. Chicken and vegetables over noodles. 
Have been more than a dozen times have tried most items on the menu. Was dieting and had #46 several times.  It had been a while since I had been in. I walked in and the man that always greets you yelled,"Hello number 46!"  I guess you want to go where they know your name or number!
author: Robin L.

description:
Just checking in to Pho Tan Hoa which in my opinion is the best Pho Soup Noodle place in the whole San Francisco Bay if not the whole State of California !!!
Just got back from Southern California and they got nothing on you Pho Tan Hoa!!!
Fresh beef pho and fresh chicken pho noodle soup.
LOVE IT!!!
author: Sake B.

description:
This place is hella expensive for pho! I paid $13 after tax and tip for a small bowl of beef and meatballs - although, they give you a gigantic portion. 

Pros - clear noodles! Not everyone has them, so that's a plus.
Cons - meat was super raw and it made my soup cold :( also might have messed with my tummy after.

MEHHHHh...
author: Angela L.

description:
Came here for a bowl of pho at lunchtime and there was no wait.  We were quickly seated and ordered the large sizes.  The pricing on that was surprisingly high for pho in the city, which is probably my biggest complaint about this place.  

When the bowl came, I noticed that there was a lot of meat in here, which was great!  The meat came really raw - much more raw than I was comfortable with, so I spent a while cooking it in the soup.  The pho was pretty average tasting.  There wasn't anything that really stood out to me especially, but it was definitely a solid bowl of pho. 

I would definitely consider cheaper options in the future, as I think I could get similar quality food at lower prices elsewhere pretty easily.
author: Tim L.

description:
The pho itself is quite tasty, and very filling. Yummy soup base, a ton of meat (it had around 12 beef slices!), and plenty of noodles.

The menu is a little disappointing. All of the pho bowls come in the small size (with a few toppings). If you want to grab a large bowl, you have to get the bowl with all toppings. Personally, I'd rather have all the selections (with fewer toppings) be able to come in any size you want (for more flexible pricing).

The worst thing is the price of the pho. Getting the large cost me $13, which is definitely much higher than other pho places in the TL. I'd rather save money and go elsewhere.
author: Desmond C.

description:
This is like holy grail pho in SF. Cash-only unfortunately but so worth it. I got Pho Ga with Young Eggs and asks for a side of fatty oil. It's fatty oil that intense the flavor. Sooooo good. 

Super recommend everyone trying it. Their beef pho is really good as well. Too bad they close at 4pm :( 

Best southern pho in SF!
author: Ritney N.

description: This is my favorite pho spot in the Bay Area. Even though it is in the TL, it has a perfect 100/100 health score.
author: Roneal J.

description: Have to specify your size carefully or else you will get a large. Was not great, very disappointed. Bad services and bad experience overall.
author: Alisa K.

description: Cheap meat, and a sad fish in the corner. Probs the worst spot in the area, but the rest of the hood is really dank. The broth was okay tho. Over priced too for low quality, place feels like a front for money laundering
author: Andrew C.

description:
This is definitely some of the best pho in the Bay and better than Turtle tower. First, the staff is Vietnamese, so that adds to the authenticity of the food itself.

I came with a friend and ordered a pho tai, shared some shrimp spring rolls, and also tried the Vietnamese coffee. The pho broth is savory and you can tell that they don't use the simple seasoning powder cubes but rather stew bones and meat instead. It comes with the standard onions in the soup, and they offer a generous amount of mint leaves, basil, bean sprouts, and lemon. The spring rolls were crisp and refreshing. The coffee was dripped over condensed milk so it was a treat to watch and it was very strong, as expected.

For authentic pho, check this place out over Turtle Tower!
author: Steven V.

description: Moving from North San Jose to SF meant losing close proximity to a ton of amazing Vietnamese restaurants :( However this place has consistently satisfied my pho cravings over the past year. Beef and chicken are both good and I've also tried their fried spring rolls (yum!). I like the option to order a large or a small. Cash only, speedy service -- solid option in the Union square area
author: Hana S.

description:
This is ur pho place everyone and I've been to Vietnam I lived there for about a month actually so I know better than literally anyone in the whole world what good pho is like. Yes, I am pho master yoona chun, I've been endorsed many times on LinkedIn honestly. 

But I digress.

This pho is the beefiest tangiest meatiest goodness and you can tell it's really good because the wait staff don't even smile at you. They don't need to bc the pho is legit!!!! Put some of the basil in it and u will feel urself sex chat!!!! Ok!!!
author: Yoona C.

description: Love this place! The broth was nice and hot and really hit the spot. Out of all the pho places I've been to, this place gives the most meat! I loved the rare steak because they were just so thin and soft.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Took the guidance of my uber-driver San Francisco food gurus on this one, during a recent trip to said city.

Upon stepping out of my ride shortly after the sun had set, I immediately wondered if I'd made a bad decision. The area was.. well... exactly what you'd expect when you hear about San Fran's less affluent areas.

Upon entering, the atmosphere was instantly younger and more relaxed, full of young foodies and hipsters... not that such is ever a sign of good food, but it was enough to allow my trepidation to subside slightly.

And holy hell, I'm glad it did, because this was probably the best pho I've had this side of the Pacific ocean. Quality beef, savory broth, and just the right mix of spices. In a city full of pho places (of which I managed to visit nearly 7 in as many days), this place took number one by a landslide.
author: Anthony S.

description:
This is probably my favorite southern vietnamese style pho restaurant in SF! I would come here more often but it's pretty out of the way for me and located in a sketchy part of town. I always get the medium house special (#8). The hot, steamy broth is packed with so much flavor, just thinking about it is making me drool. It isn't too salty either! There is no need to gulp down cups of tea after (unlike some other places). The meat to noodle ratio is perfect. I never leave thinking there was too much/ not enough of something. They don't skimp out on the meat and the noodles have the perfect amount of chewiness. Ahhh so perfect! 

I normally come on a Sunday around noon, and never really had to wait for a table. Parking might be difficult.
author: Nancy C.

description: Wasn't the best pho I ever ate, but better than any pho around the tenderloin area that we tried.
author: Cecilia H.

description: It was a good place to eat some Vietnamese food the pho I ordered was ok not bad but not great. The waiter that attended us was knowledgeable and quick. If you're looking for amazing pho probably try some place else , oh and they give you a lot of meat to noodle ratio.
author: Daniel V.

description:
My favorite bowl of bun bo hue!

The dangerous trek into Tenderloin is totally worth this spicy bowl of goodness.  Fully flavorful broth and an assortment of mysterious meats including chunks of blood and pigs feet.  Am I not selling it?  Well you have to try it to believe it, you won't regret it!  Be prepared to sweat a little.

Their pho and other offerings are also pretty tasty, the bbq pork in any of the rice/noodle plates is absolutely delicious!  Service is super fast, the man always taking orders is charming in that gruff Asian uncle kind of way.  

Tips and Tricks
-Golden Star is my standard for pho, but Tan Hoa's bun bo hue beats theirs!
-Cash only!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Pho tan hoa will be my favorite place for a Pho. Service made me feel welcome and seemed happy to be working there, which definitely earns them extra points. Other food also greats egg rolls, rice plates, etc...
two thumbs up !!
author: Saebom R.

description:
Cash only! 

It is in the TL, but the walk there isn't too shady. The TL definitely has its gems and this is another little known but good pho place. 

As another reviewer mentioned, it is a no frills sort of place. I went here with a group of ten people. There was no wait in line on Friday lunch hour. We were in a rush between meetings, but that was not an issue here. The food came out so fast. Probably less than 5 minutes? We were in and out of the restaurant in half an hour. Everyone ordered small sizes but the portions were generous. Each small bowl was around $10 though. Pretty flavorful and tasty meat. I enjoyed my #9.
author: Christina G.

description:
One of the best phos I've ever eaten.  The broth was good and the noodles were on point but what really took this bowl over the top was the quality and amount of rare beef that was in it.  Albeit the large bowl was $12, I literally had spoonfuls of just beef left over at the end.  Also the beef is literally raw in the center when it comes out.  If I had to guess it had to have been at least 6 or 7oz of high quality beef. 

***Cash Only***

This is the 2nd most expensive bowl of pho I've ever eaten but kinda worth it.  Not sure I'll do the large again though in the future.  The large is HUGE, twice the size of your average large bowl of pho.  

It was also nice to be eating out of real ceramic/glass bowls and spoons as well as the chili oil (also in a glass container) was at the table along with the chopsticks and hoisin.  

The water was also clean and tasted good.  Service was solid.
author: Sam L.

description: Best phò in SF. I eat here at least once a week. Takes me back to Vietnam every time. The cha gio are also delicious. They can be very busy. But are also very fast.
author: Jake E.

description: Speedy service, they are so friendly, and they are open for breakfast!!  The restaurant is clean and they are on top of drink refills.  I love that they offer 3 different sizes of pho.  Def cured my hangover.  They are cash only and have an ATM inside so don't worry.
author: Kristin B.

description: First pho place that I know charging for ice water, portion is kind small, other than that is good
author: Ricky Z.

description:
The MSG here is not a joke!!
I ordered a Bun Bo Hue and it taste pretty well when I had it. The feeling right after finishing the dish is really painful due to the MSG.
If you are looking for some place for Vietnamese food, this place ia not bad. It offers a wide selections of vietnamese noodles and some of their appetizers are yuumy too.
Just make sure you're ready for the MSG!!!
author: Janice N.

description:
I orderd the "Bun thit nuong" with pork. It tasted very authentic but IMO the fishsauce was a bit too sweet (theyre from south vietnam and they usually eat sweeter), never the less it was good and tasted fresh. The owner is a bit weird but still a funny guy. The food was prepared really fast and the service was friendly as well. I'd give it a 4.5 if it was possible. Not 5 because sitting there is very uncomfortable because of the table. You cant place your legs normally. 
You schould definitely give it a try and I'd even come again
author: Duy-Nam B.

description:
No frills pho in the Tenderloin, a few blocks from the main area of Little Saigon.  Bodega Bistro is still my favorite bowl of pho, but theirs is pretty solid here.

Pho Bo: Huge bowl!  A ton of rich umami broth.  An abundance of al dente rice noodles.  A little skimpy on the beef balls, but very generous with the brisket and rare steak.  I really liked the steak slices since they were sliced extremely thin.  With so many thin pieces, you can really soak up a good amount of sauce when dipping them in sriracha and hoisin.  I also liked the chili oil; seemed to have some garlic in there in addition to just chili.
author: Adam B.

description: First time I've had pho at 8:30 in the morning! Quick service, and the meat was incredibly tender (not dry or rubbery like some pho). Cash only so make sure you don't just come with a card!
author: Vanessa G.

description: One of the most pho-filling places to get pho! The portion is SO big. It is a huge bowl, filled to the brim with noodles, and order #7 has so many slices of beef, tendon, tripe, balls, etc. Definitely keeps your appetite entertained with all the textures of meat!The broth is on the lighter side, and the noodles were cooked al dente, a little harder than I usually like, but overall, everything is super delicious!
author: Ke C.

description: The food was adequate, but the service was something less than desired. We each ordered the #8 Pho, an order of Spring Rolls and an order of imperial Rolls. My girlfriend had one of their dessert drinks and I had the Cafe sua da. Half way through our meal my girlfriend and I were given our check said said they would package our food to go. If they would have told us they were contemplating closing the restaurant we would have gone elsewhere before ordering.
author: Edward E.

description: This is shop is my ultimate favorite. I always rave about their pho to all of my friends. I grew up in the tenderloin, so the location is perfect for my family to come here on a Sunday brunch. I usually get the #8 Special Pho in medium bowl with rare steak on the side. The broth is very flavorful. They do not skim out on the meat. The rare steak is super fresh. I cannot wait to get more!
author: David Dat T.

description:
When you're missing home and mom isn't around. Pho Tan Hoa is the answer when you're feeling under the weather, when it's cold outside or nursing a hangover -- actually any day is a good day for a big piping bowl of pho. 

Service is friendly and efficient. Other Vietnamese staples such as bun bo hue, bun rieu, bo tai chanh, goi ga, and che always hit the spot as well.
author: Tee N.

description:
This is my go to pho spot and I only get the #12 (rare beef).

Broth is rich and meaty. The #12 comes with plenty of beef, even in the small order. If you order the medium or large, you will want to come in hungry or be ready to take some home. I get the large for take out as it is enough for 2 meals.

Pro tip: The closed sign goes up at 3:30pm, but you may be able to still order take out. Just go in and ask.
author: Joshua C.

description:
One of the better pho places in the City. they go overboard on the fresh vegetables and there is little need to contribute any hoisin or sriracha to the pho bo. you also get a LOT for your money.

the beef quality is decent as are the noodles (not the best but upper 10%), however the broth is top 5 in the city. no question.

also, be sure to ask for the rare beef (pho tai) on the side and not already in the soup.
author: Mike V.

description: Great lunch stop when you're in SF. Amazing food, fast service, no nonsense. Huge menu and great sized servings, never disappoints. Cash only. Tenderloin parking, so, good luck. Get here before the noon rush hits, place is never empty.
author: A O.

description:
I've had my share of pho bowls in my lifetime so I think I have a pretty good sense of what is good or bad pho. So far this has been the best pho I've had in San Francisco. I usually order the special and it all comes with the usual fixings. Obviously the star of the show is the broth and this one is less sweet and more beefy with great flavor. 

I've also had the bun bo hue and bun with marinated pork. I think pho is their specialty. The bun no hue is different than what I've had before. This one is lighter with more hints of lemon grass and fish sauce. The bun is good with generous portions but the marinated pork were these super thin slices that had a little bit of that old pork flavor. 

Dishes run about $10-12 and they close early so it's usually people here for lunch.
author: Jennifer S.

description: This pho place is tasty! The broth is good and they give you a fair amount of meat. The location isn't a good neighborhood and I suggest going with someone. Despite that, this place has a good health score and service! I forgot to take a photo of the Pho but it is very good with good portions! They also have Siracha sauces that you can use to dip your meat in. Lastly, the prices are reasonable!
author: Angelina G.

description: Came here on a Saturday afternoon for lunch with the boyfriend. Parking is a little difficult and the area is filled with homeless people. This place wasn't packed when we arrived, so we got seated right away and got our menus. The orders here are really big, and more expensive than normal. The pho my boyfriend ordered was around $15, but it was a really large bowl that even he had time finishing. I ordered an appetizer of 2 spring rolls and 2 imperial rolls (half and half) which was around $9 (also slightly more expensive than usual, however they offered the half and half dish so yo i didn't have to order two full dishes of the rolls). I ordered their longan drink as well, which was a little on the sweeter side, but not bad. I got an order of bun bo hue to-go and my meal came out to be $44 for lunch. Wasn't expecting to pay so much, but their portions and flavor was delicious. Especially the bun bo hue, so that one is highly recommended.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Yes, yes, all the yes.

Stopped in for a "Pho brunch" with my husband on the first day of our honeymoon before we drove up the California coast for some wine tasting... and it did NOT disappoint. We are both big pho lovers and we were so impressed that we actually had to rearrange some of our previously planned end-of-trip schedule to make a stop back in here before we headed back home (yes it is that good).

No frills, cash only, great menu options and easy access to condiments and accoutrements typical for pho. My husband and I loved the Pho Bo (note, the large bowl is ENORMOUS), and also the Bo Tai Chanh (what I would describe as a Vietnamese beef carpaccio). 

We live in Virginia and we still joke about reasons for us to head over to San Fran for Pho Brunch again. It was a wonderful honeymoon memory, but an even better memory for the taste buds!
author: Jessie I.

description: My go to place for pho, hands down! Generous portions of beef and the soup broth was so goooood!
author: Kelly W.

description: I always forget to get the bon bo hue when I come here. I don't come here too too often because it's so far out of the way and in the Tenderloin. My friends and I came here last Friday. The pho broth was not very great, watery, and the meat was very tough. I tried my friend's bon bo hue and instantly regretted not ordering that one instead. I have to say that the man who works here HUSTLES you hard, which can be both good and bad. Good because people can easily come in and out if there are long lines. Bad because you're trying to think of what to order but he's breathing down your neck and asking what you're going to order the first 40 seconds you sit down. Overall I would say this place is okay but definitely not my most favorite.
author: Monica L.

description:
This place is my favorite viet/ pho place in SF. Often full with the other type of Asians too. (I'm Thai) *probably that how you can tell that they are good" lol  

I love their pho (chicken) I especially come here for chili oil that they provide. 

As I said on my tip. They see my face every other day. They remember what I will order. They know I love extra jalapeño, lemon, bean sprouts, basil and they just give me a lot every time
author: Fah Z.

description:
Pho Tan Hoa Thursdays have been a staple for me and my office mates for over a decade. The food here isn't the absolute best Vietnamese you're going to find, but it's definitely way above average. Their beef broth is quite tasty and the ingredients are generally nice and fresh. Just prepare yourself for the ambiance... there isn't any! It's important to note that you have to walk through the Tenderloin to get here so keep that in mind

The staff are extremely accommodating. Ask them for extra vegetables - done! Ask for fewer noodles - done! A side of beef broth? Done!

The portions are very generous. The bowls themselves are huge. If you order the large Tai (thinly sliced beef) soup, you could reasonably expect at least 20 slices of beef, what seems to be a pound of noodles, and not quite a quart of broth. Ask for the BBQ pork bun bowl and you will not regret it!

Stop by here when you're hungry and you'll walk out stuffed. Just remember to leave something on your plate or you'll wonder why you ate so much!

Overall, good food and a lot of it!
author: Michal B.

description: Delicious. Lots of meat. They didn't make a big deal about me substituting veggies for noodles which I appreciate. Go!
author: Ed S.

description:
I was starting to believe that I couldn't find a legit bowl of pho in SF.  I mean Kevin's is good, but its far out.  With most place charging $10 for a bowl up here, and for mediocre tasting ones, it was a pretty sad scene.  Then one day my friends and I checked this place out for lunch, and finally, legit PHO!!!

This is also a $10 bowl, but compared to other places, its HUGE!!! Also, if you get #7 (the combination special large) it has all the different meats.  I feel like other places don't have all the meats!  Broth is on point, doesn't taste watered down, even if you come later in the lunch period.  

Service is a little slow and not the cleanest environment or safest hood, but for good Pho, its worth it.
author: Veasna H.

description:
The guy who took our order cracked me up, I would go back just for that. It was like a Vietnamese auction for pho. Hot noodle, hot noodle, you want #14 or #12, egg roll, egg roll how many egg roll, #14, #12! I was basically like Jesus yes yes I want all of that!!! 

On another note, the broth was delicious and the egg rolls were also very good. Although, pho in DC can for sure compete! Cash only, they do have an ATM inside though.
author: Emily D.

description:
This is probably one of the better pho shops in the city.

The portions are generous. The service is friendly and efficient. However, the pho broth is light on flavor and can use more depth.

It is a solid offering when looking for a spot in the area.
author: Phat T.

description:
I've been coming here for over 13+ years and it's literally one of my favorite place for Pho. It's nice to see that their customer base has grown significantly over the years. One time they even ran out of beef Pho and it was only 2pm! However the only problem with the popularity is that when it gets really busy, they can have bad days and the quality in taste goes down, but it is rare! Most days it's delicious. 

Their prices have increased and are a bit higher compared to other Vietnamese restaurants (about $2 more than typical), but I think it's still worth it and your tummy will leave feeling satisfied. 

I ordered the Pho Tai Bo Vien and the amount of beef meat that was in there, oh lord. As you can see in the picture, it was layers on layers, and keep in mind I only ordered a small LOL. This is the most I have ever gotten, probably more meat than noodles hahah! Pho is always my go-to order here and it never disappoints. 

I've tried the vermicelli (beef and eggrolls) and this is just as good! Definitely recommend if you don't want soup. The rice plates come with sauce and a bowl of beef broth soup (to-go it doesn't have the soup). 

NOTE: CASH ONLY! They do have an atm inside or nearby liquor stores. 

PARKING: street, very very limited, can be hard to find. Multiple parking garages nearby. 

SERVICE: amazing, I've know the owner for years and all this time he still remembers my order!

**It is in the Tenderloin so be wary, but don't pay them no mind and they will leave you alone.
author: Vivian S.

description:
Great food and extensive menu.

Reasonable price point.

Quick service.

Hard for English-only speakers to order.

Sketchy location but food makes up for it.

Could have used a refill of water.

Very generous portions.

But honestly, the food was great.
author: Daryl D.

description:
Yum! Stumbled upon this hidden, well reviewed, cash only, family establishment that serves up solid Vietnamese hot soups and iced coffees. The menu can be a bit overwhelming with the variety of hot soups and other dishes (of rice, noodles, etc), so feel free to venture off the menu and tell them exactly what you want. Whether it's just pho or pho with only three ingredients, they will please.

Try #36 - it's a hardy pho alternative with thicker noodles and meat galore!
author: Regina D.

description: Mom and pop store, taste good......
author: Grace G.

description:
Great Pho!

The people that say this is in a sketchy neighborhood or too expensive need to step out of their Brady Bunch lives.

The amount of meat in their Pho is much more than normal and the broth and fresh greens are great 

Wish it was lime instead of lemon to add to the Pho but other than that it was near perfect
author: Laura S.

description:
Arguably the best Vietnamese restaurant in San Francisco. Yeah, yeah there's probably plenty of others but all the telltale signs of a great Asian restaurant are present: it's located in a relatively sketchy area, all of the decor and kitchenware is clean enough just to eat comfortably, a majority of the demographic is Asian/Vietnamese (from my experience), and their host seems to always be this gruff middle-aged man who just doesn't seem to give any fucks! For real. He's out there hustlin'!

Now for the information that's probably more relevant. It's super cheap, especially for SF standards, and the flavor of the food is always on point. I recommend the Pho, Bun Bo Hue, and Bun/vermicelli noodles. Each of these dishes are around $10 and are always on point. 4/5 stars fershuree! Place is never that packed and can probably seat up to a party of 10ish. Keep in mind their hours are 8AM-4PM! Don't make the same mistake of craving Pho in the evenings :(
author: Brandon T.

description:
Large portions for decent prices. The food quality isn't great though. The large pho can be easily split among two people. The quality of the meat isn't great but they give you a lot. Egg rolls and BBQ pork over vermicelli noodles were okay. The BBQ pork slices were really thin so it didn't have the chewy tender texture I'm used to. If you're looking for something to satisfy your Vietnamese food crazing, this won't. But you will leave full.

Cash only. Charges 0.50 for tap water.
author: Nicole J.

description: Very good Vietnamese food in San Francisco. They have a decent broth. Prices not too bad either. The neighborhood outside is kind of sketchy.
author: Peter K.

description:
It was a pho-feeling-kinda-day. Driving around the Tenderloin area with friends and randomly looking for pho restaurants, and decided to give Pho Tan Hoa a try.

This place certainly looks like a local Vietnamese restaurant - decorations, tables and chairs - so I was expecting some pretty good quality pho. It turned out...

#Bun bo Hue: C+.
Pretty bad. Once the server put down the bowl I already knew it's bad by looking at the color of the soup. It was literally regular pho soup adding some chili oil. And after I tasted it - yup, it's exactly what I was thinking. Very bland. Pork knuckle, pork blood etc were almost tasteless. 

My friends who got regular pho said theirs were pretty good. But Bun bo Hue is a pretty specialized dish so if a restaurant puts it on the menu, I would expect it to be at least pretty authentic. Unfortunately that's not the case here.
author: Simon C.

description:
Pho Tan Hoa is home to one of the best pho broths I've had! Like others have mentioned, it's a darker broth and is more flavorful. (Think the opposite of pho ga broth.) Seriously did wonders for my hangover.

Also, portions are HUGE. I ordered the #7 (which is a large bowl) and I couldn't even make a dent. And there's SOOO much meat... there's probably more meat than noodles. You could easily split a large with two other people and have everyone be content.

If you're an egg noodle lover, you're in luck -- they use the THICK kind of egg noodles which is, in my opinion, much better tasting than the thin variety. :)

CASH ONLY!
author: Jennifer K.

description: Portions are a good size with reasonable prices. Pho flavor is adequate. General cleanliness is very good. I would return next time I visit SFO area.
author: D K.

description:
The place we originally wanted to go to was closed and so we ended up here. Place was super packed from the time we walked in, to the time we left. Good option for dining close to golden gate theatre but there are other vietnamese options in the TL. 

Service is sub par, and the space is super cramped. The food is pretty good and averagely expensive for SF but a lot more than I expected from the TL. A vermicelli bowl with BBQ pork and an imperial roll was around $13. It was pretty tasty - a crispy imperial roll, a lots of lettuce, and plenty of pork. My friend got a dry noodle (soup on the side) with some mysterious orange sauce - it was also pretty good.

**cash only**
author: Veronica L.

description: Just finished yet another bowl of pho tai. Favorite place to get pho pho breakfast, super clean place. Charming wait staff, excellent quality of beef, hot delicious broth. My favorite pho in the entire city.
author: Alicia T.

description:
This place gets loud, crowded, and noisy. My friend and I came for lunch on a Friday, and sat among a lot of construction workers. I ordered their prawn and imperial roll vermicelli bowl. I couldn't tell exactly what was in the imperial roll, but enjoyed its deep fried crispiness. They give a big portion for all their meals; friend got a "small" pho which was more than enough food so the "large" must be gargantuan. I too had leftovers of my vermicelli bowl. The  sauce had enough flavor so that I didn't need to add much to it. A good meal to power a day's worth of sightseeing. 

Note: cash only, and pay at the desk after you eat.
author: Amy G.

description:
The Tenderloin has some of the best pho, but unfortunately we didn't feel this place was one of them.

Service: 
Typical for a pho place. No complaints here. 

Ambiance: 
There was a strong smell of bleach. Granted, it's great that they keep clean, but it was really off-putting right before a meal. 

Eats: 
The pho was good, but the quality of the steak was just okay. We'll go somewhere else next time.
author: Susan G.

description:
Efficient pho spot. Quick service, good pho.
Lots of borking, feelin dat. 
Fresh rolls were aight, 2.5 stars.
I got #11, 4 star
author: Skyler R.

description:
After spending a whole morning walking in the Tenderloin while serving the community (and eyeing lunch places), we decided that Pho Tan Hoa looked like the best option. A quick search on Yelp showed it had 400+ review and worth 4 stars! While the Tenderloin is considered less "cleaner" than other areas in the city, the restaurant as a pass on the health inspection AND it's as clean as your typical pho place. 

The pricing is a bit confusing, as there are lots of combinations of meat and bowl size. But in general, expect to pay more than the amount you'd pay in South Bay. Crazy right?! Spring rolls are a great indicator of how strange the prices - they're $1-2 *EACH*. The meat is nicely cooked and with the large size, there's a generous amount to satisfy my pho craving. I'd always go with the large size to get the best bang for your buck. 

Service is attentive and our orders came out quick. Oh, they're cash only so be prepared for that.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Undoubtedly one of the best places for pho in the Bay Area. The service rivals that of a fast food restaurant - quick and no frills but still attentive. I placed my order and got my bowl of pho in 3 minutes. 

The broth is perfectly spiced and rich. I normally don't drink the broth out of concern there is too much MSG, but this broth was too good to let go! The meat was also fresh and tender. 

It's not cheap - about $12 for a medium bowl, but you won't regret it!
author: Cee J.

description:
Review for Saturday lunch, around 1:30p, eating solo.
- busy during 1:30 on a weekend, good sign!
- ordered a small no. 7 noodle soup, it was gigantic! Also an Vietnamese iced coffee, so dee-lish!
- total was $15, pretty good for the size of the noodle soup.
- the noodles came with beef, order it on the side. It was buttery soft as it cooked in the broth.

Tip:
CASH only!

Definitely will make a return trip.
author: Mary H.

description: Possibly best pho in the city. Restaurant is shockingly clean.
author: Lukas F.

description: The table next to us ordered at the same time, but theirs arrived 30 minutes earlier than our food.
author: Alton L.

description:
Awesome, cheap, quick, perfect for hangovers.

How is this place not more crowded? I always get the rare steak and brisket combo in a medium and it's way more than enough to fill me up. The broth is delicious... rich in beefy flavor, and full of delicious pho spice.

Also, the Viet male server is great! fast, to the point, no frills. Just good food.
author: Katie N.

description: When the temperature drops or the rains hit downtown, I always crave pho, specifically pho ga. I willingly trudge through the Tenderloin to get a bowl of piping hot pho to warm me up. Things to know about this place. Service is quick and brusque. They only take cash, so come prepared. A small bowl will run you about $10... damn the city is expensive! The pho broth is passable, but nothing fantastic. The soup comes with the usual accompaniments of lemon/lime wedge, basil, bean sprouts, & jalapeño slices. A friend had the beef stew with bread and raved about how hearty and delicious is was. Overall, don't expect too much from this no frills pho spot.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I don't see anything special about this place.
I am more of a fan of cleaner broth and this was more of darker heavier broth.

Their small pho seemed like a medium and the service isn't too bad for an Asian place.
Abundant amount of noodles and beef for around ~$10.

There's also an ATM machine in the restaurant in case you forgot cash.

I ordered beef ball and it was alright...
Didn't hate it. It did a decent job of getting rid of my hangover.
author: Eunice K.

description:
Hey... this is a worse place to come on Sunday ... they closed at 4pm .. if you come around 330pm your bad luck... owner will rush you order and gave you 5 mins to finished and walk out ....and very rude services .

Second the taste of the food was horrible taste Pho ... soup base was a bit sour and have no beef flavor at all
I am Vietnamese and I guess this place for Chinese and Americans only .... if you are Vietnamese please don't ever come and try .....waste your money
author: Tan L.

description:
My vietnamese nail lady recommended the pho here.
I LOVED IT!

The broth is so flavorful, there was plenty of meat, and the noodles cooked perfectly!
I ordered the well done brisket and tendon and both were cooked so nicely.
The egg rolls were delicately fried and filled with a yummy pork stuffing.
It's a bit pricey though.  Pho & cha gio was almost $17.  Cash only but worth it!

It's located in the Tenderloin so it's a bit sketchy with a bunch of un-normal people outside.  
I'll be back.  Hopefully soon!
author: Seung Eun C.

description:
After a a day of having a bit too much to drink, I was craving some pho for electrolyte/carbohydrate repletion.  I fired up my trusty Yelp app and typed in "pho."  Yelp led me straight to Pho Tan Hoa.  After a few minutes of dodging the crack addicts in the area, I found a parking spot a block away.  

Walking inside I was immediately seated at a community table next to a homeless man who wouldn't stop talking to me for about 10 minutes. (After which time he realized I was ignoring him and he walked away).  I ordered the special combination, chicken  pho, and spring rolls.  The service was friendly enough (about as I would expect for this type of restaurant).  

#7 (special combination large):  The bowl was huge!  I don't think one person could finish the entire bowl.  It was full of all the different types of meat, tendons, and tripe.  The side plate of bean sprouts and thai basil was a nice addition to the soup.  The broth was flavorful and not too salty.  I would say that it was a solid bowl of pho, but I've had better.  4/5

The chicken pho was was also pretty good.  (Not amazing).  A generous amount of chicken and noodles.  3.5/5

The spring rolls were fresh with a generous amount of meat and shrimp.  The peanut sauce was not my favorite.  3/5

Total with tax and tip was $37 (for two people).  There was probably enough food for 4 people.  Overall a decent value and above average pho.  I would go back if I was in the area and had a craving for pho!  Oh, and my car didn't get broken into while I was eating so that's good!
author: Paul W.

description:
A very authentic pho joint and a very friendly owner. I think if you like rich flavored broths, you would really enjoy this place. Unfortunately It's a bit too much on the sodium/oil for me. 

Another highlight of this place is that they give you SO much meat. I'm pretty sure my small bowl of pho was like 30% noodles, 70% meat. :P This is great if you like meat....but I really like noodles so I was a bit sad about that. That said, the meat is very fresh and tasty.

As others have mentioned, cash only. I wouldn't mind coming back but it won't be my favorite pho place.
author: Sophia H.

description: I ordered the pho ga and was not impressed. The broth reminded me more of hieu tieu than pho with fried onions in it. There wasn't much meat either and it was $10 for a small bowl. Having had excellent pho in the South Bay, this was my first and disappointing bowl in the city.
author: Doug D.

description:
I came here with a group of 7, and we found this place while yelping for a lunch place with a TV (because the guys wanted to watch the football game). We got seated right away, and our food came out almost immediately as well. I got a medium sized steak pho (you can get small, medium, or large). The medium definitely filled me up, but I would've been content with a small. My friend ordered a large, and when we first saw it (with our hungry bellies), we didn't think it was as massive as other Yelpers described it, but when I looked at the bowl with my full belly, the bowl definitely looked much bigger. My friend couldn't finish his large haha.
This place stands out from other pho places because you get a lot more meat. The quality of meat was also better in my opinion. The broth seemed heavier (unhealthier?) but I have no complaints about that!
author: Annie S.

description:
The staff here assaults the homeless 

I was with Eric S. And saw all of it happen. The woman did approach customers t beg for money and food. When the employee approached her she asked him for food too and he instead yelled at he to leave. All of this was well within the employee's right to do. Then he crossed the line when he grabbed her by the hair and threw her into the tables and chairs. He then dragged her by her hair out of the restaurant. Once she was outside he picked her up by her hair and her clothes and LITERALLY THREW her onto the sidewalk. I don't care what she's done in the past few moments or years, she is a human being and did not deserve such treatment. I was so disgusted that I informed the server that j would not be paying for my meal because I was so offended by how the woman had been treated. He did not make any attempt to get me to pay the bill. 

I will never eat here again and I recommend that you don't either
author: Jewel S.

description:
Great place for pho. Their spring rolls are the bomb! Just the right balance of herbs, fresh and crispy veggies. Another neighbor table commented this was the best in the City. I'll reserve that judgement until later.

Warning, cash only!
author: Ming W.

description:
One of my favorite places for pho in the city! Family run, the customer service is quick and friendly. 

The main reason to come here is that the broth is really full of flavor. As others have noted, the portions are huge--a small is enormous. If you like a lot of meat, this is the place for you. I usually ask them to include less, lol.

If you have never had pho for breakfast, this is a great spot to try it, as they open at 8 am. Order a Vietnamese iced coffee (with condensed milk). You will have your soup and coffee within a minute of sitting down. Somehow my day always goes smoothly after eating here.
author: Mary D.

description:
After the first night of Dreamstate I needed a hangover cure ASAP. It was a tough decision between this spot or another noodle shop, but I was so glad we chose this place instead. It's honestly the 2nd best noodle shop I've ever been to.

I was seriously amazed at how delicious the broth was at first sip. The large bowl didn't contain just broth though, it was packed with noodles and all the things that come with it like slices of beef, tendon, tripe, beef balls, etc. You could honestly share a large if you wanted to, but if I were you, I'd get my own bowl!

My girlfriend ordered bo kho, which is basically like a beef stew/soup with a sweet and beefy broth. It's often times a little on the oily and spicy side depending on where you go. It wasn't as sweet as I normally would like, but it was full of flavor and they did not skimp on the meat or noodles.

At first I was a little shocked and disappointed at how expensive everything was, but after BARELY finishing a large and considering how good everything was, it was understandable. I probably won't be going back up north any time soon, but when I do, I will absolutely make sure I stop by here at least once. Just remember to bring cash!
author: Kurtis C.

description: Hands down best pho I have ever had, the broth alone would have earned them 5 stars.
author: Alex I.

description:
Best pho in the city with huge portions! 
Same guy has one manning the front of house since I started coming here over 10 years ago. While the pho has increased in price by A LOT it has still kept it's delicious flavor.

Only draw back is it's location... And cash only.

Keep up the great work!
author: Liz N.

description: Not bad, i would say the food is a little better than average, don't expect great service
author: Zhen L.

description: The real deal, extra huge bowl of pho.  Silky smooth and flavorful broth.  Fragrant spring rolls.  Bustling with other folks who realize this is delicious too.  Top three pho's I've had.
author: Mike L.

description:
I would give 0 star if I could. One thing to let you know that I have never written a bad review and this is the first time in my life bcuz they DO NOT RESPECT customers. I just want to let everyone knows how rude they are, how bad their customer service is.
       1. Last few weeks, my mom ordered dry noodle soup for togo. She told the lady behind the counter NOT to cook the noodle, because I was going to eat it at night (6hrs later). I can cook it later The lady disagreed and said "the chef here cooks noodle better than you". But she DIDN'T UNDERSTAND that the noodle will get sticky after 6hrs. My mom didn't want to agrue with her and let she did what she wanted. Sadly, I couldn't eat it and their noodle was thrown in the trash that night.
        2. Today, my mom again ordered the same dry noodle with uncooked noodle. I was going to eat it ealier last time. This time, the lady listened to my mom. I was so happy. HOWEVER, they FORGOT to give the small togo container of soy sauce. My mom came back right away to tell them. The lady, waiter and chefs said to my mom "We already put it in the bag. If you want to ask more, then say want more, don't blame us" WTF!!! Their talking way was SO RUDE to my mom. My mom said "If I need more soy sauce, I have it at home and DON'T NEED to come back to WASTE my time. Your soy sauce must be better than mine, bcuz it's FOR dry noodle and I just want to let you guys know that you guys forgot to give me". They kept BLAMING my mom and looked at her like alien. OMG! I couldn't believe it. How horrible service they have! Now I and my mom will stay away from this HORRIBLE restaurant.
author: Tina C.

description: They give u hella meat, that's for sure, but barely any soup (cuz the bowl is about 60% meat). The broth wasn't flavorful to me, it was very beefy tho. It didn't have the warm richness I love in pho tho. I didn't really enjoy my bowl of pho but I can see the appeal if ur main priority is meat. Also it was pretty pricey for pho, but I guess it's cuz they give u hella meat.
author: Jasmine W.

description: Nice and clean, really big bowl. Really good for a breakfast with hot broth.  The coffee is nice too, owner shows me how to make it.
author: Cynthia Y.

description:
Beware they charge $0.50 for iced water!!!! They did state it in the back of the menu that water was $0.50 but one would assume that's bottled water, not tap water! What's even more outrageous is that 1) when they asked if I wanted water, they did not tell me water was extra $0.50 and (2) the bill did not itemize the water separately. So if you don't recalculate the bill, you won't even notice that they charged extra for tap water. 

While the pho is good and authentic, this kind of practice is super shady and deserves 2 stars knocked off of their overall rating.
author: Audrey W.

description: Great cheap Vietnamese food with large portions. They are cash only but have an ATM inside. They have a menu with pictures and I suggest you try something other than pho because  Vietnamese food is so much more than that!
author: chad w.

description: I had the chicken pho, and I was surprised how good the broth was. The service was quick and overall it was a good value.
author: Winny F.

description:
#21 pho well done brisket and tendon = win! I ate it all. 

The chicken noodle soup = awesome, too!  It was a lighter alternative to pho.

#3 summer rolls = delicious. Plenty to go around, too! (Took home two of the four rolls, and they were so awesome to actually wrap it in plastic and then put into a container. Trust me, not everyone cares.)

They have a delicious iced tea, too!  Yeo's soy bean milk drink, and other drinks available. Served with ice in a glass! 

Prices = moderate. (Pho was around $9. Drinks were around $2.)

Service = efficient.  They will provide ice water upon seating!  

We'll be back.  Gotta remember this place!!
author: Fannie S.

description: The large bowl is HUUUGGEEE. Our pho came 5 minutes after we ordered. Tastes great and the boss is really nice too.
author: Annie C.

description:
Unfortunately I didn't have Pho here despite it being a pho establishment. I did have the shrimp roll appetizer which was pretty large and too heavy for me to finish on my own, but tasty nonetheless.

Service here is super fast and efficient, especially if you come during off peak hours. The food is served almost immediately after you order.

Would love to come back again for the pho!
author: Christina N.

description:
They open early for all you early risers with massive hangovers.  The pho is decent and comes with LOTS of meat.  Like, almost too much, but that's the better alternative than too little meat (like their neighbor Turtle Tower).  

Service is fast, to the point, and very blunt.  Which is fine with me, I want to be in and out of the TL with a quickness. 

The BBH (Bun bo hue) is actually pretty decent here.  I'm a huge BBH fan and usually turn my nose to 99% of the places that are not BBH An Nam in SJ.  My little sister isn't as picky, so she got it.  I actually liked the broth.  I'd order it next time I'm here in search of a hangover cure.  =)

Happy eats!
author: Vicky T.

description: My hubby and I were in town from LA and needed a pho fix...found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try..we're glad we did! The pho was amazing and the portions were huge! I got a small and it wasn't as small as I thought it was going to be and for the price, you can't go wrong. If you're in town or near by and need some pho in your life this is the spot to go to!
author: Melissa G.

description: Real, Authentic PhO delicious so much you can't get its anywhere truer than here. Only flaw is that the manager always likes to charge me more than what's on the menu and he only does that kinda thing TO ME.i don't like that....
author: Abigail S.

description:
Had the bun bo hue with pho noodle. One of the best flu Vietnamese restaurants I've had. Surely best in the city of SF. I paid about $11 for a good portion. Come check it out. Be careful, if you're not use to the hood, this place might not be for you. Enjoy!

-Black Tiger
author: Teason M.

description: Got take-out and had a great experience.  Order the pho tai and iced coffee with condense milk, which was ready for pick-up within 5-10 minutes.  All the ingredients of the pho, including the beef, were packed individually for maximum freshness.  (A lot of other places lump the raw meat with the noodles, which ends up being a congealed and bloody mess. Yuck.)  Broth was extra savory.
author: Julie H.

description:
This is my new favorite place to get phō in the city! It was pretty busy so I sat myself. The waitress let me know right away that they were closing in 5 minutes but that I could stay for another half hour to enjoy my meal. She was very friendly and that's all I needed anyway. 

I ordered the small rare beef phō and thought she had mistaken it for a medium! Great value for the price and it was absolutely delicious. 
When I bring my friends from out of town I'll have to let them know that the sketchy walk through the Tenderloin is definitely worth it once you try their soup.
author: olivia a.

description: I can't believe this happened. I came with me and my boyfriends and we were so ready for the chicken soup. But my uncle came out and said there was no soup left. I cried. Enough tears to the point where I made my own soup.
author: Justin T.

description: Awesome Pho and the rest of the menus looked good too. Very authentic and friendly staff--will go again!
author: Sherry A.

description: Been here every time I visit SF for business and stay in the area. The pho never disappoints. The price for a Special Bowl seems to have gone up but the added ingredients makes it worth it. Still we are talking about $10 for a medium bowl that will fill you up quickly. The ingredients are fresh. Depends on the time of day you visit, I do find the pho under or over cooked.
author: Christopher N.

description: Good pho. Wasn't sure how long to book the parking meter for. But we had our pho within 5 minutes of ordering. I booked it for an hour, could've done 30 minutes and been fine. The owner is very friendly and attentive. Family owned. Good quality pho. Very generous with the tendon and rare beef. Great place if you want some good noodle soup.
author: Nathan K.

description: Nice soup. One of the better pho places! Too bad they only accept cash but regardless it's a great pho.
author: John K.

description: Decided to come here for our hangover since it's was close to our hotel. Once you walk in the door the aroma was already hitting your nose. 5 star for the pho broth!!! Chicken and beef broth did not and I mean NOT taste artificial at all. The pho doesn't need any other additives. My now go to pho place in s.f.
author: Kristina X.

description:
Good customer service .
Spacious space . 
Awesome Pho . Should try Pho Kho ( tow bowl Pho - separate soup ) 
Special filter vietnamese coffee ( cafe sua da )
author: Anh Hai L.

description: Havent been here in over 15 years. It is still one of the better pho places in the City. Hot , steaming broth with good flavor and lots of meat!
author: Ho N.

description: I really enjoy the food here! And on the bright side, they're open on Sundays--my friends and I usually go here right before a matinee musical nearby, so it's a great food option to have. I always get the Bun thit nuong cha gio and it's very tasty here. Ample servings and VERY fast service, you pretty much get your order within minutes of ordering.
author: Jenn C.

description:
If you want straight up pho bo, with plenty of meat, Pho Tan Hoa will do the job. It's a walk through the Tenderloin, so keep that in mind. However, once you get inside you're in for a treat.

I'm always a fan of brisket and tripe, and this place gives you quite a lot. I can't really use the phrase "bang for your buck" because pho here is pretty expensive - we're approaching double digits guys. But I think the broth is above average and you'll have a good time.

In terms of apps, I'm not as big a fan. The cha gio/egg rolls were good as always. The goi cuon/spring rolls were a little on the big side and felt like a chore to eat even with the peanut sauce. 

Because this is a pho place, you know there's a giant pot of stock waiting in the back. Your pho will probably come out before any other food item, so keep that in mind.
author: Dave N.

description: Super fast, friendly and clean. Broth was delicious and portion sizes are big. Got a small rare steak and beef brisket. Very tasty!
author: Devon S.

description:
MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE PHO PLACE IN ALL OF SAN FRANCISCO!!! I've been here so many times that the owner knows me and has memorized what I like to order and how I like to eat it. This place has saved me from many a painful Sunday afternoon and bears many fond memories for me. It's a no-frills, authentic pho joint; the owner is quick, terse, the food is good, the service is bare-bones. Just the way a pho joint should be; I'm very skeptical of all these "high-end" pho places ripping people off in SF for $15 a bowl just because the servers come around more often to refill your water.

My favorites from this place include the Pho Tai (rare steak pho; order your steak rare on the side, marinate it in lemon juice, and cook it yourself in a side bowl of broth), the Bun Bo Hue (spicy beef noodle soup), Pho Ga (chicken pho) and the Bo Kho (beef stew). The Bo Kho is some of the best I've tasted anywhere (including San Jose, which is famous for its numerous pho joints). Copious amounts of meat and noodles for about $10; in fact, when I order, I usually request less meat because they give you so much.

Vietnamese coffee (ca phe sua de) and the coconut juice (with fresh coconut meat) is also excellent. Protip for all you hungover folks: coconut juice here will make you feel like a new person.

They are cash only but have an ATM located inside the restaurant in case you're cashless.
author: Chrystal Z.

description:
My group and I were crazy....tired...from the night before and we were craving pho. Based on the reviews, we chose this place. 

WARNING: DO NOT ORDER THE LARGE BOWL OF PHO. Unless you can eat like an elephant. And I don't mean that in a bad way! Being from Portland, we are used to our "large" bowls to be perfectly portioned for breakfast on a Saturday or Sunday morning if you catch my drift....so without knowing, the entire group ordered a large. We barely made a dent in it! I felt so bad.

The broth was decent. We were thinking it was going to be more flavorful but then realized that Portland does have great Pho. And I'm Vietnamese - I know Pho. 

The best part of that bowl of Pho was the massive amount of meat they gave us. We were in AWE, and felt like the meat supply was infinite and coming out of  Mary Poppins' magic bag. The meat was delicious,  too!

One person ordered the Bun Bo Hue and the broth was amazing on that bowl. I'd love to order that, should I ever find myself there again.

The service was awesome. The owner that took our order was so funny and nice and made jokes with us, so it was a super pleasant experience.
author: Michelle M.

description:
I came here because of all the people talking about good Pho and thought I was closer than I was to the place. So after finally committing to coming, I realized that this place is closer to downtown than Civic Center, but I committed and had the time. 

Finally arriving I see there is a bunch of homeless across the street waiting in line for the free showers. Next to the building is an alley way with a couple more homeless sleeping away.

So I still walk in and the guy cleaning up the tables seats me right away, at the 2nd table from the door. I was OK with it in the beginning, but as I sat down and began going down the menu of what to order, I began smelling a strong smell of urine from the streets. I gotten so bad I was set to walk out if they didn't move me far away. They ended up moving me to the back, knowing it was the smell.

So I ended up getting the #7 Pho Xe Lua Tan Hoa house special well done brisket, flank, tendon, tripe, beef balls & slices of rare steak. So the bowl arrived within 5 minutes and the bowl was big, but the contents was a little more than half. I tossed my sprouts and everything else in there and began to eat. 

I was able to finish the whole bowl and most of the noodles within 15 minutes and I wasn't that hungry. Towards the end I was feeling kind of sick due to the fact I still smell the urine when they left the door open. 

I felt like I was eating in the restroom and really couldn't enjoy the food. I had been to other places in the tenderloin where the smells wasn't as apparent as this place. So I will not be returning.
author: M C.

description:
Nice place for some good Vietnamese food. Easy walk from the muni 38

I had the shrimp and egg rolls on vermicelli noodles.  Very fresh and tasty.

The fish and egg noodles soup was good too.

Everyone around us ordered huge bowls of pho and not one person finished their portion. Lots of leftover food left on the tables after they paid and left.  

We took our leftovers home and it was great later.

The Vietnamese iced coffee is excellent.
author: Foodlover B.

description: I always order #17 Large - less rare beef and more tripe. The noodles here is pretty good and good portion size (they give lots of meat). The owners are very nice and good service here. The ~15-20min walk from work for lunch is definitely well worth it.
author: Sherry Y.

description:
Be a little careful around this neighborhood, its not the best part of town. 
It is deep in the heart of the Tenderloin, but the food is good and the prices low.
It is a cafeteria like interior, with fast friendly service.

I really like their food.

Favorites here:

Fresh shrimp rolls

Pho with BBQ Pork and spring roll

Bun bo hue - Great authentic  broth with pork blood cubes, and pork/fish cake slices.
author: David T.

description: Always come here whenever I'm staying in SF. The broth is rich and the sprouts and basil super fresh.
author: David S.

description:
I've eaten at this restaurant several times and the owner is so incredibly rude that I will not return. Each time he ignores us for substantial lengths of time, even if we try to get his attention, before we can place our order. At the end, he never delivers the check or acknowledges us when we try to ask for it. 

The last, and final, time I ate here he decided to clean, dry, and replace all ceramic cutlery at the table directly next to us. This went on for 20 minutes while we ate without an apology or an explanation. It was extremely loud, disruptive, and made it impossible for us to have a conversation.

I discourage you from eating here unless you want to be made to feel not like a customer, but like they are doing a favor by serving you. It's up to you.
author: J H.

description: Best beef noodle soup in town! I've been to most Vietnamese noodle soup restaurants in SF but this place is by far the best. I really enjoyed so many different choices here. chicken broth or beef broth, both are excellent choice! You will love it!
author: Dustin P.

description: Just no. Barely edible. I honestly felt my $15 would have been better spent littering the ground. It was super crowded, but I'm just not sure why...I found it awful.
author: Tiffany S.

description: We stopped here for lunch. They're not open for dinner. You immediately get a whiff of the pho aroma after entering. We started with the fried egg rolls. It was very good but a bit pricey for four pieces. I've had it countless times before for a couple dollars less. My friend had the Chicken Pho. I got the Hu Tieu with egg noodles, pork, chicken, fish balls, and fish cake. Both soups were delicious and full of flavor. The portions were also generous. The service was super quick. The food came out in about 5-7 minutes. You come here for the amazing food, not the decor or warm hospitality.
author: Anna C.

description:
Hello, hello. You give me number. Come now, come now.
Absolutely love this place. Been coming here for years and is our favorite. It's clean. And the Pho is awesome. We keep trying other places, but PTH has the best pho. The flavors are perfectly balanced. The portions are super generous with lots and lots of beef. Shrimp rolls and other dishes are good too. Check it out if you're in The Loin. Open daytime only - they close by 5 every day.
author: Dallas H.

description:
I am quite disappointed in people like Eric S and Jewel S. who twisted stories on the yelp review. People like these two should be banned from writing reviews for hurting businesses across town. Notice jewel have no friends? I wonder why this is her only review.  I myself I'm not a Yelper to post negative comments. 

This restaurant is well operated and the food is absolutely delicious. I only eat here because the staff is phenomenal and fast service. They pass city health inspection well above 90 scores every time. 

People like Eric S and Jewel S are scums, the same dirt below the sewer pipe, Taking advantage of the situation leaving without paying their bill then immediately post a twisted review to support their own action. This is no way to support a local community small business.  Same with that "Ali" guy who claims refunds up n down Clement St towards small pastry shops.   Your type of People are ruining the community, Eric n Jewel!

I was at the restaurant and I felt very bothersome by that incident where a homeless person was taking food from everyone's table. The homeless woman not only smell bad but was ranting and screaming and provoking slurs.  The staff DID NOT grab hair or throw her out as described because I was there.

People!  Stop your lies
author: Mike M.

description: I'd say this place has some good meat, and broth. noodles needs a little work. This old guy that tells people where to seat needs to just chill. I'd say hire more workers and keep him in the back of the house. They can lose customers easily they way they're working. Good food after all, not any better than Pho Hoa in San Diego though. If you're looking for great, bomb, A1 authentic pho, go to San Diego and search for Pho Hoa.
author: Shaira A.

description: Awesome serving of pho. I got tendon and beef balls in a small bowl (beef soup). Normally I get a few pieces of tendon. They gave me so much here I almost didn't finish it all. Also the small bowl is larger than you might expect and just $10. Downsides were I found a small piece of hair, a little longer than eyelash length, as well as a tiny bug. I'm not scared of insect protein but I'm glad I saw them and took them out. It was, however, disappointing to see. I think the meal was almost worth it.
author: Ke D.

description: The service is truly speedy and their menu has all the Vietnamese staples. It's located on a pretty rough block, but once inside you're solid.
