I tried the place down the street and all of the usual haunts in Little Saigon, but my cravings still direct me here.  Get the combination beef pho.  Oh yeah, and the owner greets you with "hello hiiii."  I love it.
author: L P.

description: this is another childhood place and i swear ive been getting the same dish ever since. yes...i can get pho anywhere but this is the only place where their pho co (dry pho) is bomb. i dont even remember if i ever ordered another dish here. i love this place and will continue to come back whenever im in the mood for some dry pho.
author: Tuan D.

description: for the longest time, ive always wondered why my frens would call this place hello hi! when i finally tried this place, i was greeted with "hello, hi" hahahah. anyways, i didnt know what to order, so my frens ordered for me! ive had pho before, so this time they insisted that i try the dry pho! oOoOoOH LOVE IT! DELCIOUS! i havent gone back yet, but i have been craving for their dry pho!!!!
author: linda L.

description: okay, i know i'm white but i grew up in east san jose, with tons of vietnamese friends and have eaten pho virtually all my life.  this is good stuff, in my opinion.  the best i've found in SF for sure... still searching for somewhere in Oakland that comes close.  i took my best friend here (she's vietnamese) and she thought it was quite good so i can't be that far off.
author: Yvette H.

description: I live in nob hill, so it's a sigh of relief to know that i don't have to obsess over the next time I'll be in San Jose for a decent Vietnamese meal.  This place is clean, spacious, and very quick.  The "large" bowl of pho can fill two people.  The bunh thit noung (sp?) is delicious too!  I can't wait to go back.
author: LT B.

description: A friend who lives in the neighborhood recommended this place.  If you're not from the city and has a faint heart, don't visit this place.  The neighborhood is dirty and has signs everywhere that says "Do not buy drugs on this street"  If you're from the city, who cares right?  Anyway, back to the food... The pho is good.  IT's $7 for a huge bowl.  I like how they don't care how you want you're pho.  They just accomodate you and it  just feels really home-y.  My friends and I went his Saturday and I wanted my pho half thin egg noodle, half thin rice noodle, soup on the side and he just took it all in and no mistakes.  My friend wanted the rare beef with thick egg noodles instead of rice noodle and they were fine too.  No extra charges for all this work.  They are the best.  They know what they are doing in that kitchen.  Their English is not good, but hey, that is what authentic food is all about!
author: AhLin C.

description: One of the best Vietnamese pho in town and very reasonable.  The portions are pretty big and usually crowded.  The waiter repeats everything over and over and sometimes it's hard to understand him.
author: Mary L.

description: One of the best pho in the city. My coworkers and I have been here at least once a week for the last six years.
author: Tim N.

description: best place to get pho in the city hands down.
author: Phillip V.

description: It's becoming my favorite place for pho. Generous portions, delicious broth, and usually ready in 5 minutes or less for pick-up orders. My co-worker and I have decided that we will only have pho for lunch if we order from here.
author: B N.

description: dirt cheap and yummy in my tummy. plus it's in the heart of the TL so that equals free entertainment!
author: Jeannine S.

description: http://blog.tinou.com/2007/08/pho-hoa.html
author: Tinou B.

description: Delicious Pho at a Grand Price, but not so bad when you see how big your bowl of pho is (coming from Houston, a bowl of pho is $3-4; i know rent is cheaper!) - at a price of $7.65 for a large bowl, I thought WOWSERS - but it was worth the try. Boy, was it worth it! You can feed two people easily (well I also got some spring rolls). The broth has clearly been eating away at the carcasses of some big beefy cow and the meat they give you is so absolutely tender - raw beef & tendons. The spring rolls come out FRESH and definitely do not have that "old taste", "prepared a couple hours ago" taste...phew. Must try more here....
author: Jeannette L.

description: i only ate here once, and so far i think its the best in the TL, so thats pritty much saying its the best pho in town. having said that its real viet, and kinda sketch area. but i can overlook it
author: rae m.

description: I am not Vietnamese but my gf is and she is from the most Vietnamesed out place in the US, Westminster. Two great things, the auctioneer style waiter/owner who talks so fast and is always trying to up-sell and cross-sell but regardless of what you order, always  happy. Secondly, this is the only Viet place I know in SF that has the Beef Stew w/ French bread and it's realllllly good. The Pho itself is obviously not as good as in Westminster but honestly it comes close and is pretty good. Only minus is that it's cash only but if you're looking for pretty cheap good Pho or Beef Stew, can't go wrong here. Just be sure to bring $10 cash per person.
author: pankaj l.

description: the pho was quick, hot, meaty, salty, and delicious. now that i think about it, that kind of sounds more like a strip club in the tenderloin than it does a restaurant. still, while this isn't as close to home as i would like, it's a reasonable stroll, and tu lan is closed on sundays, so i'm pretty sure i'll be back now and then on a lazy sunday afternoon.
author: Jon W.

description: I know vietnamese food like no other. I'm vietnamese myself and besides home cooking, this is the best place to get some Pho. They put very little msg in here plus everytime my boyfriend and I come in to eat, the vietnamese guy who works there always remember us so he just says our regular orders out loud to make sure we didn't change our minds. Now that's what you call excellent customer service. Best place in the city for some pho, I don't like it anywhere else just because its way too much fat elsewhere.
author: Miss D.

description: one of my favorite pho places.. rare steak soup is great!!!
author: miniMe M.
